# Abstract / Key Points

- Stimuli: Images and sounds
- People can distinguish anger and disgust 
- Both perceived anger and disgust are associated with direct and indirect aggression
  - Anger is more strongly associated with the former, while disgust is more strongly associated with the latter
  - Anger is overall more strongly associated with aggression than disgust
  - The associations between indirect aggressions and anger and digest are the similar
